page.title: 10Mount Pleasant Area,Belper
page.content: The area around{Belper Lane}and {Mount Pleasant Drive}has a great variety of housing,from houses about 15 years old to cottages dated about 1860. Behind the houses on{Pinewood {Rd.}is a field where the Derbyshire County Council was going to build a primary school. Now they plan to build houses. The residents have formed a protest group and have asked to rent the field to extend their gardens. There are two{General Stores}on Belper Lane and one is an Off-licence. There is{Belper Riding Centre}at Hill Top and a Scout Hut at the bottom. { } From{The Homestead}in{Dalley Lane} Mr.Hancock delivers milk. At{Dalley {Farm,}Mr.Fletcher has 60 cows milked in a parlour, 4 cows on each side. About 900 litres a day goes along pipes to a refrigerated tank. A milk tanker takes it to the dairy.
